DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Oncotype DX Breast Cancer Assay Progesterone Receptor Status Result Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the result of an Oncotype DX breast cancer progesterone receptor assay, a diagnostic assay that quantifies the likelihood of breast cancer recurrence in women with newly diagnosed, early-stage breast cancer.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Oncotype DX Breast Cancer Assay Progesterone Receptor Status Result
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to the result of a medical procedure that involves testing a tissue sample by the Oncotype DX breast cancer assay (a diagnostic assay that quantifies the likelihood of breast cancer recurrence in women with newly diagnosed, early-stage breast cancer) and progesterone receptor status (the progesterone receptor level measured in a primary tumor or in metastases).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredName: Oncotype DX Breast Cancer Assay Progesterone Receptor Status Outcome
Property.preferredDefinition: Oncotype DX is a diagnostic assay that quantifies the likelihood of breast cancer recurrence in women with newly diagnosed, early stage breast cancer. In addition to predicting distant disease recurrence, Oncotype DX also assesses the benefit from certain types of chemotherapy. The assay, performed using formalin-fixed, paraffin-embedded tumor tissue, analyzes the expression of a panel of 21 genes and the results are provided as a Recurrence Score (0-100). The gene panel was selected and the Recurrence Score calculation was derived through extensive laboratory testing and multiple independent clinical development studies. Oncotype DX is validated for use in breast cancer patients whose disease is newly diagnosed, stage I or II, node-negative, estrogen receptor-positive and who will be treated with tamoxifen. (from genomichealth.com):Indicates the progesterone receptor level measured in a primary tumor or in metastases. (>=10 is positive if measured in fmols/mg cytosol protein; Otherwise use institutional standards):Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic assay that quantifies the likelihood of breast cancer recurrence in women with newly diagnosed, early stage breast cancer. In addition to predicting distant disease recurrence, Oncotype DX also assesses the benefit from certain types of chemotherapy. The assay, performed using formalin-fixed, paraffin-embedded tumor tissue, analyzes the expression of a panel of 21 genes and the results are provided as a Recurrence Score (0-100). The gene panel was selected and the Recurrence Score calculation was derived through extensive laboratory testing and multiple independent clinical development studies. Oncotype DX is validated for use in breast cancer patients whose disease is newly diagnosed, stage I or II, node-negative, estrogen receptor-positive and who will be treated with tamoxifen.
Indicates the progesterone receptor level measured in a primary tumor or in metastases. (>=10 is positive if measured in fmols/mg cytosol protein; Otherwise use institutional standards)

ValueDomain.preferredName: Oncotype DX Breast Cancer Assay Receptor Score
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the Oncotype DX breast cancer receptor score.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.
